techmeme.title: The FBI says cybercriminals and online scammers stole a record $16.6B in 2024, up from $12.5B in 2023; over 60s lost $4.8B, including $1.8B via investment scams (Kevin Collier/NBC News)
Roku updates its $30 Streaming Stick and $40 Streaming Stick Plus, saying they are "the most compact sticks on the market", and unveils new software updates (Chris Welch/The Verge)
Nvidia announces the general availability of its NeMo platform to build AI agents, supporting Meta's Llama, Microsoft's Phi, Google's Gemma, and Mistral (Kyt Dotson/SiliconANGLE)
Endor Labs, which scans AI-generated code for vulnerabilities, raised a $93M Series B, taking its total funding to $163M, and says it performs 1M+ weekly scans (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Microsoft launches new OpenAI-powered AI agents, Researcher and Analyst, designed to function as digital colleagues, available via its Agent Store (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
